text.name: sys_description
text.text: The CPS is a JAMMA arcade system built by the Japanese company Capcom in 1988. Based on a Sharp X68000, it was a 16-bit system far ahead of the rest. But in 1990 the Neo-Geo MVS made its appearance and the first update of CPS came out in 1992 with the Q-Sound stereo system. Then the CPS2 in 1993 with a QSound3 chip and cheaper to produce. Finally comes the CPS3 in 1996 with a new chip Hitachi 25 MHz. Despite the smoothness and fluidity of its animation the CPS3 has not met with great success with only six games in total.
